shortdesc.ph: Play the specified audio effect to the specified channel.

p.codeblock: public abstract int playEffectEx(RtcConnection connection, int soundId, String filePath, int loopCount, double pitch, double pan, double gain, boolean publish);

- (int)playEffectEx:(AgoraRtcConnection* _Nonnull)connection soundId:(int)soundId filePath:(NSString* _Nonnull)filePath loopCount:(NSInteger)loopCount pitch:(double)pitch pan:(double)pan gain:(NSInteger)gain publish:(BOOL)publish;

section.p: This method allows you to set whether to publish the audio effect in the channel. To play multiple audio effect files simultaneously, call this method multiple times with different soundId and filePath. It is recommended to play no more than three audio effect files at the same time. After preloading the audio effect using , you can call this method to play the specified audio effect to all users in the channel. Each call to this method can only play one audio effect. To play multiple effects simultaneously, call the method multiple times.
section.note: If you have preloaded the audio effect file into memory using , you can use this method to play the audio effect.

ul.li: Agora recommends playing no more than three audio effects simultaneously.
The sound ID and file path in this method must match those used in the method.

section.title: Scenario
section.p: This method applies to multi-channel scenarios.

plentry.pd: The ID of the audio effect.
The ID of the specified audio effect. Each audio effect has a unique ID. If the audio effect is preloaded into memory using , ensure this value matches the one used in .
The absolute path of the local audio effect file or the URL of an online audio effect file. Supported formats include mp3, mp4, m4a, aac, 3gp, mkv, and wav.
The absolute path (including file extension) of the local audio effect file or the URL of an online audio effect file, such as . Supported formats include: mp3, mp4, m4a, aac, 3gp, mkv, and wav.

Number of times the audio effect loops:
-1: Loop infinitely until or is called.
0: Play once.
1: Play twice.

Set the number of times the audio effect loops:
0: Play once.
1: Play twice.
-1: Loop infinitely until or is called.
Pitch of the audio effect. Range: 0.5 to 2.0. Default is 1.0 (original pitch). The smaller the value, the lower the pitch.
Set the pitch of the audio effect. Range: 0.5 to 2. Default is 1 (no change). The smaller the value, the lower the pitch.

Spatial position of the audio effect. Range: -1.0 to 1.0:
-1.0: Left.
0.0: Center.
1.0: Right.

Set the spatial position of the audio effect. Range: -1.0 to 1.0.
0.0: Center.
1.0: Right.
-1.0: Left.
Volume of the audio effect. Range: 0.0 to 100.0. Default is 100 (original volume). The smaller the value, the lower the volume.
Set the volume of the audio effect. Range: 0 to 100. Default is 100. The smaller the value, the lower the volume.

Whether to publish the audio effect in the channel:
: Publish in the channel. Remote users can hear it.
: Do not publish in the channel.

Set whether to publish the specified audio effect in the channel:
: Publish in the channel. Remote users can hear it.
: Do not publish in the channel.
The start position of the audio effect file, in milliseconds.
The start position of the audio effect file (in milliseconds).

section.props: bp cs electron flutter native rn unity unreal
section.p: When the method call succeeds, there is no return value; when fails, the exception is thrown. You need to catch the exception and handle it accordingly. See for details and resolution suggestions.

ul.props: bp cpp cs electron rn unity unreal
ul.li: < 0: Failure. See for details and resolution suggestions.
